Posts.Content:
Hey Sheri,
i have an appointment to see the surgeon in 4 weeks. I guess the point is they dont know it IS a fibro.. if it is i woudnt be concerned at all, ive had one over 20 yrs.. they are totally harmless! they dont know what it is, they are guessing based on my history and its size, which just isnt good enough for me. I have two friends who had theoretically harmless lumps that wound up being cancer. I will update when i have met with the surgeon!
Louise
Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content: Hi this is my 1st post here. I was diagnosed wit fibroadenoma when i was 19 (i am 45 now) had one removed as it was large, the other was left and has never changed in 25 years. This year at my regular check up (because of the FB) they found something new.. it's .7mm .. def not the old lump. They didn't see it at 1st then called me back a week later for follow up 3D mammogram and then another ultrasound. Now i have to go for a core needle biopsy.. but i have heard they are unreliable. I live in Canada, so i don't have insurance worries, but i have to wait 3 weeks.. i have other anxiety disorders that in the past have presented as chest pain and asthma like symptoms. not sure how i will make it through 3 weeks, plus another one for the report.. i know that a lot of lumps arent cancerous.. but i'm kinda freaking out.. any advice taken .

AgeInfo.Phrase: wit fibroadenoma when i was 19  i am 45 now  had
i was 19  i am 45 now  had one removed as

Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content: soooooo went to the Dr this AM, they said that the biopsy was clear, BUT that they were 100% sure they actually GOT any of the mass. What do i do now?? they said to wait 4 mths and have another ultrasound to see if it has grown! what do i do if it has? what if it is an aggressive tumor and in 4 months im screwed! I cant handlt the not knowing.. i feel like i have a ticking time bomb in my chest. Its' been 2 months already, i dont think my brain will make in another 4 months without knowing *** is going on .. im so mad.
Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content: had the Core Needle Biopsy one week ago today (10th Feb) - still waiting for the results.. will def post either with joy or distress when i get them! My cat has been very sick this week as well, which was an unwanted and expensive though useful distraction!
Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content: Hi this is my 1st post here. I was diagnosed wit fibroadenoma when i was 19 (i am 45 now) had one removed as it was large, the other was left and has never changed in 25 years. This year at my regular check up (because of the FB) they found something new.. it's .7mm .. def not the old lump. They didn't see it at 1st then called me back a week later for follow up 3D mammogram and then another ultrasound. Now i have to go for a core needle biopsy.. but i have heard they are unreliable. I live in Canada, so i don't have insurance worries, but i have to wait 3 weeks for the biopsy.. also they said i cant switch clinics to get in anywhere else faster cos they would need to re-do all the tests.. how is that possible in a digital age? i have other anxiety disorders that in the past have presented as chest pain and asthma like symptoms. not sure how i will make it through 3 weeks, plus another one for the report.. i know that a lot of lumps aren't cancerous.(hell i HAVE one!). but i'm kinda freaking out.. any advice taken .

Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content: yeah no doubt. My Doc thought it was totally messed up. She is going to try and refer me to the other main testing facility here in Vancouver for a 2nd opinion. Please send good thoughts that they see me and soon!
Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content:
Hi Sheri,
it's been pretty stressful. Another Doc i trust looked over the report and her reading of it is that its not that they didn't get ANY samples, just not ENOUGH to categorically define it as fibroadenema. She is sending me a copy of it so i can ready it for myself, but my doc is still trying for a 2nd opinion. At this point even though it might be entirely unnecessary i think i'd rather have the lump removed surgically with clear margins and know i am OK than be wondering every 6mths before an ultrasound!
Will def post when i have more definitive info.. from speaking to some friends though, this seems kind of common (the uncertainty) The radiologists want to cover their butts so say "inconclusive" more often than not! In a health care system that is stretched to the limit, really it makes you wonder! One 1hr operation 5 weeks ago and everyone would know by now. But they would rather have me in for a 90 min biopsy, anf ultrasounds every 6 mths! doesnt make sense to me!
dx fibroadenema 1990, surgical removal, mammos for life!
Posts.Title: Call back for biopsy 3 weeks away.. kinda freaking out!

Posts.Content:
Hey Sheri,
so kinda funny (no funny haha) story. I decided to call the clinic that did the biopsy to see th approx date of the results. They said "oh we sent them last week to Dr XXXX" which was interesting as a)that wasn't the right Dr and b) no-one had called me to tell me such. They apologized and offered to fax them to the correct Dr ASAP, but in the interim, i called the Dr they DID advise (my old Dr, whose practice moved) and they said they didn't HAVE all the results, which was why i hadn't been called. When i called the lab back, they said, Nope they definitely have them, but we will send them again if you like. 
I decided to just go up to the new Dr's on the off chance that she could see me today. She was booked up but the reception staff confirmed they did have the results sent over today, and the Dr would look at them ASAP. She did, and sent a message back saying "no rush, come in in the next few days" .. soooo i have an appointment for 1015am tomorrow.. can i assume if they aren't in a rush i am not going to need further surgery? 
Whatever, i guess i will know tomorrow morning. I will certainly post when i get the results, but i have to admit, knowing i should have had this info on Monday is a little galling! (oh and Leo has been cleared of all "serious" issues, he has the equivalent of IBS in humans.. lots of throwing up until we find food that agrees with him!! :()
